alert.note: Alert for Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 16 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected along Beaver River. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Lewis. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding along Beaver River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 501 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain from last night has caused the Beaver River to rise to bankfull. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell in the basin. The gauge at Croghan is at 5.0 feet, and the river is expected to rise to about 5.5 feet at Croghan around midnight tonight. This crest is slightly lower than the one on August 9th this year, but still will result in flooding in some low lying areas along the Beaver River tonight. - Levels on Beaver River are expected to drop Thursday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Croghan, Castorland, Kirschnerville, Belfort, Beaver Falls and Soft Maple Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
